intro: Rubus huangpingensis, commonly known as the Huangping blackberry, is a species of bramble native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically harvested when fully ripe. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
